summary: This bill, the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act of 2025, aims to strengthen and modernize the Voting Rights Act of 1965. It revises criteria for determining which states and political subdivisions are subject to federal oversight, establishes new preclearance requirements for certain voting practices, increases transparency around election procedures, expands the authority of the Attorney General to enforce voting rights, and adds protections for election workers and polling places. The bill covers aspects of vote dilution, denial, and abridgment. Finally, it addresses the authority for assigning observers and clarifies authority to seek relief for voting law violations.
